subject: RE: [junit] why does not ComparisonCompactor have notes or javadoc?
msgSnippet: We don t document private classes. Having said that, I ll break that rule here :-) The goal of a ComparisonCompactor is to take two strings that differ and
messageBody:
We don't document private classes.

Having said that, I'll break that rule here :-) The goal of a
ComparisonCompactor is to take two strings that differ and produce two
strings that describe their difference. It does this by finding and mostly
eliminating common prefix and suffix substrings. This works well in the
common case that the strings only differ in one area.

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of ? ?
Sent: Wednesday, April 16, 2008 10:10 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] why does not ComparisonCompactor have notes or javadoc?



when I was reading junit4.4 source ,I find no notes or javadoc about
ComparisonCompactor.java .So I hava difficult in understanding about
ComparisonCompactor. Could you explain methods like findCommonPrefix (),
findCommonSuffix(),computeCommonPrefix(),computeCommonSuffix() for me?
